Hi <@U07ARLLF39N> <@U06GS7BG27J> is the mobile SDK beta still available?

I tried clicking on the "Request Beta" button but it leads to an empty tab in product updates.
This functionality is very relevant to one of our customers and we'd love to run an experiment in staging to see if it's viable for them :slightly_smiling_face:
Hi <@U044BTK3EGP> - can you try going to the following path in your portal: `/product-updates/{your portal ID}/all?update=13958555`? Hopefully that will open a side panel with the Mobile Chat SDK.

That worked, thank you!

Once the push notifications are set up, is there an API endpoint that I could call to send mobile notifications or even a way in the HubSpot UI to send push notifications?

I understand this mights stretch the definition of the "mobile chat" functionality but eventually our end goal would be to replace <http://customer.io|customer.io> with HubSpot to send push notifications on mobile as well :slightly_smiling_face:

For now it seems like the push notifications are only enabled for new messages sent as repliesâ€”correct me if I'm wrong. Appreciate your quick reply!
I believe at this time that the push notifications are specific to chat messages. CC <@UA23LN99A> <@U06GS7BG27J> for confirmation.

<@U07ARLLF39N> fyi a little trick that I've found is that you can drop in an "l" in place of the portal id (right after ".com") and it will take you straight to the page for whatever portal the user picks
EX:
<https://app.HubSpot.com/l/product-updates/all?update=13958555>

Thanks <@U01QVR44MEY> - there's an update to these links going through deployments that will be setting the correct update ID so that even with the "new-to-me" path, the side panel will be opening with the correct update.
that's awesome! I have noticed that that new to me page will fail to open updates that aren't "new to me" anymore.
